title: Arm training - Introduction to TrustZone for Armv8-A

json.text: Today, ARM TrustZone technology is the foundation  for security in applications processors,
protecting billions of devices each year.
Here are some examples of areas where TrustZone  has been used.
For authentication, some smartphones come with  iris scanning as well as fingerprint sensors to  replace passwords.
TrustZone is also used for mobile digital rights  management. Here, mobile payment is protected by  a TrustZone based Trusted Execution Environment.
An example of content protection is Over The Top  (OTT) OTT is the modern way to consume content  on your smart DTV or mobile gadget.
This relies on TrustZone Media Protection. It has  been protecting HD streamed content since 2011.
Finally, Samsung has pioneered enterprise security  with TrustZone, providing the hardware isolation  technology necessary
for integrity management, and  introducing the concept of Trusted Apps.
